alert.note: Alert for Santa Cruz (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 13 at 2:55PM MST until August 13 at 4:45PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tucson has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... South Central Santa Cruz County in southeastern Arizona... * Until 445 PM MST. * At 255 PM MST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across central and south-central Santa Cruz county. The heaviest rainfall, between 1.00 and 1.75 inches of rain has fallen just south of Nogales and near Patagonia Lake. Rainfall runoff will quickly drain into normally dry washes, roadway dips and other low-lying areas... especially the Nogales Wash as it enters Nogales from Mexico and Sonoita creek near Patagonia Lake. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Nogales, Rio Rico, Patagonia Lake State Park and Nogales International Airport. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
